Fields.DialogueText: Engine room! Give me ramming speed! All gunners, blow up anything that gets in our way! We're giving these Morganas a KO punch!
@BATTLE
And the champion is... the U.S.S. Salt Lake City!
Along with the bravest Captain the world has ever known! Hey, do you think they have root beer in New Zealand? I'm parched!
I know one way to find out.
Some Time Later
And we're docked. After that fight, I'm sure you're ready to take a breather.
Honestly, I'm not all that tired. It might be all the adrenaline, but I'm feeling great.
Shaker, you took your share of hits. You need to get yourself checked out and then get some rest.
I'm fine, Captain. I could go another round with Malice right now!
I know you think that, but let's make sure there's nothing broken under the surface or anything, okay?
Okay, fine. You're no fun, though.

Fields.MenuText: Would I be more fun if I brought you some root beer?
I'm a party pooper because I care.
Who has time for fun? This is war.

Fields.DialogueText: Definitely. You should do that. It'd also speed up the recovery.
Yeah, I know you do, Captain. I appreciate it.
You're not wrong, but I was having a pretty good time showing Malice a thing or two in the ring.
Alright, I'll go get myself checked out now. Thanks for caring, Captain.
Anytime, Saltshaker.
Oh, and we're going to celebrate this big win, by the way!
Rest first, then we'll talk about celebrations.
Hey, Saltshaker, you're looking a little... purple.
Yeah, I think my whole body is just one big bruise after that last fight.

Fields.MenuText: Aren't you glad you got some rest now?
Well, a little bit of purple is a nice color on you.
Then what are you doing walking around? Go get some more rest.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, you were right. Is that what you wanted to hear?
Thanks? I don't think I'm going to make a habit of getting this beaten up again.
Don't worry, I was just getting some ice before returning to my room for some quiet time.
Honestly, I'm glad you made me get myself checked out. There wasn't anything seriously broken, but I definitely needed some rest.
Well, after a fight like that, anyone would.
If anyone else would've tried to get me to take a break while all that adrenaline was pumping through me, I would've punched them in the nose.
What makes me so special? Didn't want to punch your captain?
Well, that and-
*ALARM*
Oh, great. Think you got it in you to help us in this skirmish?
Do you really expect me to sleep while you're fighting a bunch of Morganas? Come on!
@BATTLE
What's going on in here, Captain? I spend just a little time in bed and you've got the mess looking like a carnival?
I was hoping to surprise you.
Surprise me with what?
Well, you said you wanted to celebrate. I was putting together a little party for you.
A party? That's a terrific idea! I was actually going to suggest it myself before you forced me to sleep.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't force you to sleep, I ordered you to. There's a small difference.
I guess great minds think alike.
Now I really wish I could've surprised you.

Fields.DialogueText: Either way, I had to sleep instead of helping with all of this.
I suppose they do. Though, I would've done all this a little differently.
There's always next time, Captain.
Now that you're feeling a little better, would you like to lend a hand with this whole process?
I thought you'd never ask. I've got a lot of ideas.
Such as?
First things first. We're going to need some piñatas.
@BATTLE
Saltshaker, I have to admit, those piñatas were a great idea. The crew is loving it.
Yeah, it's nice to see everyone in such high spirits.
Except for you. Everyone's so full of energy, but here you are just sitting in the corner.
I had more fun planning the party than actually partying. It hurts to move.
It makes sense you'd enjoy putting together something nice for your crew.
I am glad they're having fun. I wish I'd hurry up and heal.
You look like you could use a drink.
You know I don't drink, Captain.
Not even root beer?
Yes, please! I forget how well you know me sometimes, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Your love for this stuff is hard to forget.
There's still plenty I don't know about you. You've got your mysteries.
You know me, too. At least I'd like to think so.

Fields.DialogueText: I wouldn't say I love it. I adore it. Love is too strong a word to toss around casually.
Really? I don't mean to. I like to think I'm more of an open book.
Yeah, I like to think so, too.
You know, just because you helped plan the party doesn't mean you have to stay for the whole thing. You can head back to your room and get some rest.
But all the root beer is here.
That is an excellent point. Let's try and enjoy this party as much as we can. How bad are those aches and pains?
Not bad enough. I think I can get out there and give the piñatas a whack or two.
That's my girl.
@BATTLE
You're looking a lot better, Saltshaker.
I feel a lot better. It took longer than I'm used to, but I'm feeling back to a hundred percent. Or, well, at least ninety percent.
That's good to hear. You'll be able to completely enjoy our next destination then.
Our next destination? Did we get a new assignment?
That's what I wanted to bring up with you. What do you think about a little vacation?
A vacation? What for?

Fields.MenuText: No reason. Any excuse to take a break, right?
You can't tell me you're not exhausted after so much fighting.
I think you've earned it.

Fields.DialogueText: I think we need to work on your work ethic, Captain.
Maybe a little, but I think I'll be fine after a good night's rest.
I've earned it? Well, thanks, Captain. I guess you might be right.
I'm not saying we won't still be fighting Morganas. We'll just be able to fight them somewhere exotic, or tropical maybe. Isn't there anywhere you've always wanted to visit?
Well... there are a lot of cultures I'm curious about. I've heard some stories from friends, but I've never really gotten to experience them myself.
Now's your chance.
I'll think about it...
All right, that's all I can ask.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
All right, let's do it, Captain. I'm in.

Fields.MenuText: My, so forward!
Okay, great... What are we talking about again?
You mean for the vacation? Fantastic!

Fields.DialogueText: Forward? What are you talking about? I meant I'm on board for taking a vacation.
I'm talking about taking a vacation. I think we've earned it.
Yeah, I did some thinking and I'm eager to explore some foreign culture.
This is great! Now all that's left is to decide where we're going.
You don't have anywhere in mind?
I've got plenty in mind, but it's your vacation. It should be your decision where we go.
*ALARM*
Preferably somewhere with fewer Morganas.
I think that may be a bit too much to ask for, Captain.
@BATTLE
All right, so where have you always wanted to go, Saltshaker? What's your dream vacation look like?
Oh, now that's a loaded question. There are so many places in the world that I'm curious about. We can't visit them all in one go.
Eventually. For now, let's focus on our first stop.
Well, where would you like to go?
I already told you, you should be the one picking.
I'm still picking, but I want you to enjoy it, too. Come on, give me some suggestions.

Fields.MenuText: There are a few nice vacation spots in Europe. It's not a tropical destination though.
Asia's always a nice touristy spot. Great place to find awesome souvenirs.
We could head to America if you're getting homesick.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't need tropical. It's not like I can really enjoy a beach after all.
I do have a few friends I'd love to get some presents for.
The States are nice, but I'm more curious about the rest of the world, you know?
I'm going to have to give this more thought.
Take your time. We don't want to get there and then have you regret your decision.
Exactly. This is an important decision. If you need me, I'll be reading in my room.
I'll make sure the crew knows not to interrupt you unless Morganas attack.
Thanks, Captain. I appreciate it.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hey, Saltshaker. Still busy with the good book?
It's okay. I was just finishing up.
Does that mean you've made a decision about our destination?
I was thinking England would be a good start. It's somewhere I won't feel completely out of my element. I'll at least know the language.

Fields.MenuText: I think that's an excellent decision.
England? For a vacation? All right.
You don't know any other languages? There's always time to learn.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks. I think it's smart to start at an easy pace.
What? Is that not a normal destination? Did I do something wrong?
Yes, but we can worry about that later. Vacation is not the time to worry about learning another language.
All right, England it is. I'll send a request up the chain of command. Soon we should be able to head out.
Ooooh, I'm so excited, Captain!
Me, too. I'm looking forward to showing you the world, Saltshaker.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hey, no one in the ring with you today? The rest of the crew already learned their lesson?
Yeah, I'm thinking I may have bested everyone on board. No one's interested in sparring with me now. Maybe I should've gone easy on them.

Fields.MenuText: Well, that might've kept them around a little longer.
You'd throw a match?
Never go easy. If you're not going to do your best, then what's the point?

Fields.DialogueText: Eh, maybe, but eventually I'd get bored of taking it easy. It's more fun to go all out.
I wouldn't throw the match, but I could make them think they have a chance of winning.
You and I see eye to eye once again, Captain.
You know, there's one person on board that you haven't challenged.
Oh, and who is that?
Me. We've never gone one on one before. Are you scared?
Oh no, I just wouldn't want to hurt you, Captain.
Part of me is hurt, but the other part of me knows you're probably right. After all, I've seen what you do to Morganas.
*ALARM*
Would you care to see it again?
I could watch a Belle like you all day long.
@BATTLE
So you mentioned before that you've heard about other cultures and countries from friends?
Yeah, from missionaries. They go all over the world to teach people in foreign countries about our religion.
And they told you stories about England?
Well, that's not the kind of place that missionaries are sent to. But I've heard different things about England from here and there.
And what exactly are you expecting when we get there?
I've heard there's a lot of fog, there's some of the best tea in the world, and they have a king.

Fields.MenuText: All accurate.
That's all you've heard?
They have a king?!

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, good. I'm looking forward to tasting some of this famous tea.
Yeah, and I'm glad I haven't heard more.
I can't tell if you're joking, or if I really know more than you.
Besides that, I don't know what to expect. I'm looking forward to the surprise.
I'll try not to ruin the surprise for you.
Please do. In fact, let's change the subject. Have you seen any Morganas around lately?
*ALARM*
I'm blaming you for this.
@BATTLE
Let's give them a right straight punch!
@BATTLE
I feel like there have been more Morganas attacking us recently...
Really? I suppose they have been attacking with more ferocity lately. Do you think we should be worried?

Fields.MenuText: I'm always worried when it comes to Morganas. Or the chance they might hurt you.
I'm sure it's nothing we can't handle.
While we're together, they should be the ones worrying.

Fields.DialogueText: You shouldn't be worried that much, I mean, we have a pretty good track record, don't we?
You're right. We'll handle them just as we've handled every Morgana we've encountered.
Heh, yeah, I guess we are a force to be reckoned with, huh?
We really shouldn't dwell too much on this. We should be looking forward to our little vacation.
Right. We have more important things to be thinking about. I'm not even entirely sure what normal people do during a vacation.
Now that is something we should be worrying about.
Captain, we've almost reached port!
I can see that, Saltshaker. Excited, huh?
I am. Do you think we'll be able to see Big Ben from port?

Fields.MenuText: You know what Big Ben is?
Maybe, but that might be a tall order.
If we're lucky.

Fields.DialogueText: From what I've heard, I'm expecting an exceptionally large clock.
Oh, that's too... Oh, I get it. Very funny, Captain.
I guess I have been feeling pretty lucky since meeting you. Maybe you're my good luck charm.
*ALARM*
Great, more Morganas.
If they're going to be such a nuisance, maybe we should put this trip on hold.
No, you deserve to enjoy your vacation. I'm not going to let a few Morgana BFs stop us.
You're right. Let's take care of these nuisances and then get back to having fun!
That's the spirit, Saltshaker.
@BATTLE
Uh, Salt Lake City, what's with the towel and the... sunscreen?
I'm heading out onto the deck to sunbathe. That's a thing people do on vacation, right?
You really don't know all that much about England, do you?
What do you mean?
Well, come up and see.
Oh no, it's pouring out!
You didn't pick a vacation spot known for its sun.
I suppose we'll have to find something else to do in the rain. Any ideas?

Fields.MenuText: We can still enjoy the weather. I happen to love the rain.
We could go shopping. I'll bring an umbrella.
There's something nice about staying in and enjoying a good book while you can hear the rain outside.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I've never been a big fan, but I guess I can see the appeal.
Sounds fun, but remember, I can't get too far from the ship.
That does sound nice. However, I did just finish that exact activity.
You know, there is another activity that's always fun in the rain.
I'm listening.
We could go on patrol. Keep any Morganas from messing with us after the rain stops.
Now that's an idea I can get behind.
@BATTLE
Saltshaker, what are all these crates the crew brought back with them?
Oh, they got my souvenirs! Fantastic. I've been waiting forever for them.
Souvenirs? All of these boxes are full of souvenirs?!
Well, I'm not exactly able to go into the city and pick out my favorites, so I told them to pick me up one of everything.

Fields.MenuText: How much money did we waste on this stuff?
It's hard to stay mad when you pull your "Can't leave the ship" card.
You're planning to go through all of these and pick your favorites, right?

Fields.DialogueText: We didn't waste anything, Captain.
You shouldn't be mad anyway, Captain. I thought this through.
That's the plan.
I'm spending as much time as it takes to sort through all of these boxes. I'll keep my favorites and have the rest returned. Perfect plan, right?
It's not a horrible plan. Next time, maybe I can just go shopping for you? I think I can manage to pick out some stuff you'd like.
But then I'd miss out on all the fun of shopping for souvenirs. This is supposed to be a vacation, Captain.
*ALARM*
Tell them that.
@BATTLE
Isn't England just lovely, Captain? I think we have the best view of it from right here.
Aren't we supposed to be on patrol right now? Shouldn't you be looking out to sea for Morganas?
Right, right, sorry. I guess this is just my version of being a tourist.
I'd love to walk the streets and take in the sights, you know, really soak in the culture, but... I suppose this will have to do.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, the woes of being a personified warship.
If you asked me to, I'd run this ship straight into the city, just so you could walk the streets a little.
Cities are fine and dandy, I suppose. For me though, the sea is the true beauty.

Fields.DialogueText: You want to take this to the ring, Captain? I may have some woes, but I've still got power behind my punch.
Really? That's sweet. Though, I'm not sure I'd get the same feel for the culture while everyone's running and screaming about the heavy cruiser lodged in the street.
You have a point. The sea is connected to every country, and every culture. I'd even say it has a culture all its own.
*ALARM*
Crap, we were too busy sightseeing to notice the Morganas sneaking up on us.
Sorry, my fault. I'll make it up to you by beating them senseless.
I'll hold you to that.
@BATTLE
Saltshaker, what are you doing in here? The sun's finally out. I thought you'd be enjoying it while it lasted.
It is? I had no idea. Why did nobody tell me?!
I'm assuming they didn't want to bother you during your quiet time.
Just give me a moment, I need to get all my sunbathing supplies.

Fields.MenuText: Still set on sunbathing, huh?
I'd hurry if I were you. You never know how long it'll last.
You don't need all that stuff. Just come out and enjoy the sun on your face.

Fields.DialogueText: This is my first vacation, I intend to do all of the classic vacation activities.
Okay, okay! I've got my towel, my books, and my... wait, where's my sunscreen?
Then it's not sunbathing, it's just standing outside, Captain.
*ALARM*
Great, Morganas come to ruin the weather.
We can still enjoy the sun while we're beating on Morganas, right?
I guess you have a point.
@BATTLE
What the... how many Morganas... they're closing in on the port from every direction!
Why? Are they... Do you think they're here for us?
Wait, Captain... do you see that ship in the distance? Doesn't that look a bit like Malice?
We need to focus on the Morganas at the forefront, Saltshaker.
Right, right...maybe I'm just seeing things...
I am positive that was Malice, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I believe you.
Didn't we already beat her into the dirt?
I'm not sure. It looked like any other Morgana to me.

Fields.DialogueText: It had to be her. I'm not forgetting what she looked like anytime soon.
Yeah, but she must've picked herself up and come back for more.
Are you kidding? There was this aura rolling off her in waves. It was definitely her.
What is she doing here?
I don't know... What I'm more concerned about is why she didn't stay to challenge me again.
We need to go after her. She's just going to come back with more Morganas if we don't.
Sounds like our vacation's over.
It's okay. This can be fun too, right?
I don't doubt you can make it fun.
Let's resupply and head out. If it really was Malice, she shouldn't be too hard to track down.
@BATTLE
Malice just won't quit, huh? How many times do you think we're going to have to defeat her before she stays down?
You know, she might not have the best motives, but I have to respect her a little.
Respect her for what?
For getting back up. We took her down pretty hard. There aren't a lot of people who would rush head first into a fight with someone they lost to.

Fields.MenuText: She's not a person. She's a Morgana.
Sounds like a stupid plan to me.
That does take a fair amount of guts.

Fields.DialogueText: And I'm a Belle. It's semantics, Captain.
You might be right. At least until it works and she defeats us.
Exactly. Her tactics may be questionable, but she's got a fighter's resolve.
You might respect her for getting up and fighting again, but you shouldn't forget that she plays dirty.
Oh, trust me. I remember the first time we fought. I won't be knocked down so easily.
*ALARM*
That's good to hear, because we've got company.
We keep getting attacked by Morganas. Do you think this is Malice's doing?
It could be. Like I said, she plays dirty.
@BATTLE
Shaker, I've got good news.
Can it wait? I just sat down to read a little.
Normally I'd leave you to your passages, but you're going to want to hear this.
Okay... I'll read later. What's going on?
We've received a location for Malice. She's not too far.
How did we get her location so easily?
You're thinking it might be a trap.
Don't you?

Fields.MenuText: No. The thought never crossed my mind.
Yeah, it could be a trap...
But now that we know it's a trap, is it really a trap?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, that doesn't bode well for our future engagements with the Morganas.
Then again, I could just be overthinking it...
Hmmm... Now that's a thinker.
You know, trap or not, we have to go.
Why?
Because we don't have any other leads. If we're lucky, when we trigger this trap of hers, she'll be there to watch. Then we'll have our chance to strike.
If you're sure. I just hope we don't end up regretting this.
You and me both, Captain.
@BATTLE
This is the location. She should be right here.
Keep your eyes open, Captain. We don't know what kind of trap we could be stepping into.

Fields.MenuText: Eyes on the horizon, crew.
Don't discount anything. I want eyes everywhere.

Fields.DialogueText: If she's sending ships after us, we should be able to spot them a mile away.
If she's sending ships after us, we should be able to spot them a mile away.
*BOOM*
Malice must've doubled down on this trap of hers.
We have Morganas closing in from every direction. She's covered all her bases.
What do we do now? We're surrounded and taking fire.
We do what we came here to do. Win.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Right. Keep your ears open for subs, too.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, trust me. They're very much on my mind.
I think that's the last of them.
How many waves of Morganas does Malice have at her disposal?!
As many as it takes.
It's good to see you survived. If you had been defeated easily, I'd have been insulted.
Finally you show yourself! I'm assuming you drew me out here for a rematch.
I was trying to get you out here for a while, but you were just ignoring all the Morganas I sent after you.
So you were sending Morganas to soften me up? I thought we were facing more Morganas than usual.
Do you know how annoying it is to have your enemy not know you're attacking them?! I had to show myself to get you to notice me.
Well, excuse me for taking a vacation.
Vacation? This is war! You don't have time to relax!
I don't know about that. I beat you pretty handily last time. I figured I earned a little down time.
You just got lucky. Now it's time for our tiebreaking match. When I'm done with you, you'll have as much downtime as you want - at the bottom of the ocean.
I've had enough relaxing. I'm jumping to get back in the ring!
Oh, please. Why bother fighting with our fists when I can blow you up instead? I won't be happy until your entire ship is in pieces.
So she was sending all those Morganas to attack us. I told you there were more Morganas than usual.

Fields.MenuText: I'm pretty sure I told you that.
One more reason to defeat her again. Hopefully that'll put a rest to the Morganas.
She could've just been bluffing. She seems like a bluffer.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? That's not how I remember it.
There's only one way to find out.
I don't think so. I mean, she does look like a bluffer, but I don't think she's bluffing this time.
She's approaching, Saltshaker. I hope you're ready for this tiebreaker.
I'm more than ready! Let's settle our score.
@BATTLE
Aggggghuughhh!
Salt Lake City, are you all right!?
I'm a little bruised and sore, but I'm not done yet.

Fields.MenuText: You always look ready to my eyes.
Get back in there and take her down.
Are you sure you can handle this?

Fields.DialogueText: Gee, thanks. Such a charmer, Captain!
You don't have to tell me twice!
I'm positive. I'm not giving up now!
If things start looking grim, I will throw in the towel and get us the hell out of here.
No you won't! You have nothing to worry about. I'm going to win!
Damn straight you are. I've got faith in you, Saltshaker. Get up and take her down.
Thanks, Captain. With you here, I feel like I can do anything.
Come on! Round two, Malice!
Kick her ass, Salt Lake City!
@BATTLE
Time for a final haymaker!
@BATTLE
You did it, Saltshaker! You won!
Just look at Malice, slinking off with her tail between her legs.
Should we finish her off? It'd only take a few good shots.
No. Maybe she won't come back as angry if we show her a little mercy.
This isn't the last you've seen of me! I will destroy you and prove that I'm the strongest. Just wait!
Or not.

Fields.MenuText: Empty threats. That's all they are.
So... torpedoes?
Are you afraid?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I wouldn't say empty. I'm sure this won't be our last fight.
No, there's no point. We'll need those torpedoes for the next fight.
A little, but I'm also looking forward to it. That's a little odd, isn't it?
It sounds like you may have made your first nemesis.
Huh, I guess we are rivals now. I'm looking forward to our next grudge match.
Man, I need another vacation.
Really? We just had one. I'm ready to get out and there and start a few fights. I feel like I've just been sitting on my hands for way too long.

Fields.MenuText: I'm joking. After that fight, I'm filled with a ton of energy.
Are you kidding? After that fight, I just want to spend the day in bed.
I'm only being half serious. It'd be nice to rest a little longer, but I know we have Morganas to take care of.

Fields.DialogueText: That's more like it. That's the attitude I like from my captain.
Tempting... REALLY tempting... but we don't have that much time to waste, Captain.
Exactly. We may have taken care of Malice, but there's no time for another vacation, Captain.
At least we were able to make the most out of our little break while we could. You had fun, right?
I did. I think I'll have just as much fun fighting Morganas for the same reason, because I'll be doing it with you.
*ALARM*
And it sounds like we're starting already. Let's get out there!
Wait...what did you just say? Because of me?
@BATTLE
Let's jab them in the kisser!
@BATTLE
Captain, I need to talk to you for a minute.

Fields.MenuText: Is this important? I'm a little busy at the moment.
Sure. I've always got time for you, Salt Lake City. You know that.
I was actually just coming to talk to you.

Fields.DialogueText: I mean... I hope it's important... I think it's important...
Well, thanks... That's kind of why... You're really sweet, you know that?
Oh, maybe we were... I don't know... going to say the same thing...
Are you okay, Salt Lake City? You seem a little off.
Well, I just... I guess I'm nervous. I shouldn't be, I'm not usually a nervous kind of person.
You're certainly not. I've seen you face down hordes of Morganas without so much as flinching.
Exactly! Then why is it that something like this has my heart stuck in my throat?
Something like what?
You know me. I'm not the sort to sit and wait for things to come to me. I go out in the world and find it for myself.
So, I'm going to do that here...
Okay... I'm listening.
I loved having a vacation with you, Captain. Would you... maybe... like to go out with me?
Heh, that's what's got you all worked up? Your face is scarlet.
Give me a break. I've never done this before! I've never... I've never felt this way about someone.
I know the feeling. It's the same way I feel about you.
Is that a "yes" then?
I would love to accompany you on a date. And another. And then another. Is that more like it?
Mhmmmm.
Then why are you still blushing so much.
The person I like likes me back. This is a normal reaction, isn't it?
Here's a better reaction for you. *kiss*
